text: Although God spoke long ago in many parts and in many ways to the fathers by the prophets,
speaker: Narrator

text: in these last days he has spoken to us by a Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, through whom also he made the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: who is the radiance of his glory and the representation of his essence, sustaining all things by the word of power. When he had made purification for sins through him, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high,
speaker: Narrator

text: having become by so much better than the angels, by as much as he has inherited a more excellent name than theirs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For to which of the angels did he ever say,
“You are my son,
    today I have begotten you,”
and again,
“I will be his father,
    and he will be my son”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
And again, when he brings the firstborn into the world, he says,
“And let all the angels of God worship him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And concerning the angels he says,
“The one who makes his angels winds,
and his servants a flame of fire,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
but concerning the Son,
“Your throne, O God, is forever and ever,
and the scepter of righteous is the scepter of your kingdom.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
they will perish, but you continue,
    and they will all become old like a garment,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But to which of the angels has he ever said,
“Sit down at my right hand,
until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Are they not all spirits engaged in special service, sent on assignment for the sake of those who are going to inherit salvation?
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of this, it is all the more necessary that we pay attention to the things we have heard, lest we drift away.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the word spoken through angels was binding and every transgression and act of disobedience received a just penalty,
speaker: Narrator

text: how will we escape if we neglect so great a salvation which had its beginning when it was spoken through the Lord and was confirmed to us by those who heard,
speaker: Narrator

text: while God was testifying at the same time by signs and wonders and various miracles and distributions of the Holy Spirit according to his will.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he did not subject to angels the world to come, about which we are speaking.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But someone testified somewhere, saying,
“What is man, that you remember him,
    or the son of man, that you care for him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You made him for a short time lower than the angels;
    you crowned him with glory and honor;
speaker: Narrator

text:
you subjected all things under his feet.
For in subjecting all things, he left nothing that was not subject to him. But now we do not yet see all things subjected to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but we see Jesus, for a short time made lower than the angels, because of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, so that apart from God he might taste death on behalf of everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it was fitting for him for whom are all things and through whom are all things in bringing many sons to glory to perfect the originator of their salvation through sufferings.
speaker: Narrator

text: For both the one who sanctifies and the ones who are sanctified are all from one, for which reason he is not ashamed to call them brothers,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And again,
“I will trust in him.”
And again,
“Behold, I and the children God has given me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, since the children share in blood and flesh, he also in like manner shared in these same things, in order that through death he could destroy the one who has the power of death, that is, the devil,
speaker: Narrator

text: and could set free these who through fear of death were subject to slavery throughout all their lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: For surely he is not concerned with angels, but he is concerned with the descendants of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he was obligated to be made like his brothers in all respects, in order that he could become a merciful and faithful high priest in the things relating to God, in order to make atonement for the sins of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in that which he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are tempted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, holy brothers, sharers in a heavenly calling, consider Jesus, the apostle and high priest of our confession,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was faithful to the one who appointed him, as Moses also was in his household.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this one is considered worthy of greater glory than Moses, inasmuch as the one who builds it has greater honor than the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every house is built by someone, but the one who built all things is God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony to the things that would be spoken,
speaker: Narrator

text: but Christ was faithful as a son over his house, whose house we are, if we hold fast to our confidence and the hope we can be proud of.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, just as the Holy Spirit says,
“Today, if you hear his voice,
speaker: Narrator

text:
do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion,
    in the day of testing in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
where your fathers tested me by trial
    and saw my works
speaker: Narrator

text:
for forty years.
Therefore I was angry with this generation,
    and I said, ‘They always go astray in their heart,
and they do not know my ways.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
As I swore in my anger,
‘They will never enter into my rest.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch out, brothers, lest there be in some of you an evil, unbelieving heart, with the result that you fall away from the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But encourage one another day by day, as long as it is called “today,” so that none of you become hardened by the deception of sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we have become partners of Christ, if indeed we hold fast the beginning of our commitment steadfast until the end,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: For who, when they heard it, were disobedient? Surely it was not all who went out from Egypt through Moses?
speaker: Narrator

text: And with whom was he angry for forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose dead bodies fell in the wilderness?
speaker: Narrator

text: And to whom did he swear they would not enter into his rest, except those who were disobedient?
speaker: Narrator

text: And so we see that they were not able to enter because of unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore let us fear, while there remains a promise of entering into his rest, that none of you appear to fall short of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we also have had the good news proclaimed to us, just as those also did, but the message they heard did not benefit them, because they were not united with those who heard it in faith.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For we who have believed enter into rest, just as he has said,
“As I swore in my anger,
‘They will never enter into my rest.’”
And yet these works have been accomplished from the foundation of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has spoken somewhere about the seventh day in this way: “And God rested on the seventh day from all his works,”
speaker: Narrator

text: and in this passage again, ‘They will never enter into my rest.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Since therefore it remains for some to enter into it, and the ones to whom the good news was proclaimed previously did not enter because of disobedience,
speaker: Narrator

text:
again he ordains a certain day, today, speaking by David after so long a time, just as had been said before,
“Today, if you hear his voice,
do not harden your hearts.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For if Joshua had caused them to rest, he would not have spoken about another day after these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consequently a sabbath rest remains for the people of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the one who has entered into his rest has also himself rested from his works, just as God did from his own works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, let us make every effort to enter into that rest, in order that no one may fall in the same pattern of disobedience.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the word of God is living and active and sharper than any double-edged sword, and piercing as far as the division of soul and spirit, both joints and marrow, and able to judge the reflections and thoughts of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no creature is hidden in the sight of him, but all things are naked and laid bare to the eyes of him to whom we must give our account.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, because we have a great high priest who has gone through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast to our confession.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we do not have a high priest who is not able to sympathize with our weaknesses, but who has been tempted in all things in the same way, without sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore let us approach with confidence to the throne of grace, in order that we may receive mercy and find grace to help in time of need.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every high priest taken from among men is appointed on behalf of people in the things relating to God, in order that he can offer both gifts and sacrifices on behalf of sins,
speaker: Narrator

text: being able to deal gently with those who are ignorant and led astray, since he himself also is surrounded by weakness,
speaker: Narrator

text: and because of it he is obligated to offer sacrifices for sins for himself also, as well as for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And someone does not take for himself the honor, but is called by God, just as Aaron also was.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus also Christ did not glorify himself to become high priest, but the one who said to him,
“You are my Son, today I have begotten you,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
just as also in another place he says,
“You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek,”
speaker: Narrator

text: who in the days of his flesh offered up both prayers and supplications, with loud crying and tears, to the one who was able to save him from death, and he was heard as a result of his reverence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Although he was a son, he learned obedience from what he suffered,
speaker: Narrator

text: and being perfected, he became the source of eternal salvation to all those who obey him,
speaker: Narrator

text: being designated by God a high priest according to the order of Melchizedek.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning this we have much to say and it is difficult to explain, since you have become sluggish in hearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed, although you ought to be teachers by this time, you have need of someone to teach you again the beginning elements of the oracles of God, and you have need of milk, not solid food.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everyone who partakes of milk is unacquainted with the message of righteousness, because he is an infant.
speaker: Narrator

text: But solid food is for the mature, who because of practice have trained their faculties for the distinguishing of both good and evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, leaving behind the elementary message about Christ, let us move on to maturity, not laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works and faith in God,
speaker: Narrator

text: teaching about baptisms and laying on of hands, and resurrection of the dead and eternal judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this we will do, if God permits.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is impossible concerning those who have once been enlightened, and have tasted the heavenly gift, and become sharers of the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the coming age,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having fallen away, to renew them again to repentance, because they have crucified again for themselves the Son of God and held him up to contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ground that drinks the rain that comes often upon it, and brings forth vegetation usable to those people for whose sake it is also cultivated, shares a blessing from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if it produces thorns and thistles, it is worthless and near to a curse, whose end is for burning.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even if we are speaking in this way, dear friends, we are convinced of better things concerning you, and belonging to salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is not unjust, so as to forget your work and the love which you demonstrated for his name by having served the saints, and continuing to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we desire each one of you to demonstrate the same diligence for the full assurance of your hope until the end,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order that you may not be sluggish, but imitators of those who inherit the promises through faith and patience.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when God made a promise to Abraham, since he had no one greater to swear by, he swore by himself,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying,
“Surely I will greatly bless you, and I will greatly multiply you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And so, by persevering, he obtained the promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For people swear by what is greater than themselves, and the oath for confirmation is the end of all dispute for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way God, because he wanted to show even more to the heirs of the promise the unchangeableness of his resolve, guaranteed it with an oath,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order that through two unchangeable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have taken refuge may have powerful encouragement to hold fast to the hope set before us,
speaker: Narrator

text: which we have like an anchor of the soul, both firm and steadfast, and entering into the inside of the curtain,
speaker: Narrator

text: where Jesus, the forerunner for us, entered, because he became a high priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham as he was returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom also Abraham apportioned a tenth of everything—in the first place, his name is translated “king of righteousness,” and then also “king of Salem,” that is, “king of peace”;
speaker: Narrator

text: without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but resembling the Son of God—he remains a priest for all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: But see how great this man was, to whom Abraham the patriarch gave a tenth from the spoils!
speaker: Narrator

text: And indeed those of the sons of Levi who receive the priesthood have a commandment to collect a tenth from the people according to the law, that is, from their brothers, although they are descended from Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the one who did not trace his descent from them collected tithes from Abraham and blessed the one who had the promises.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now without any dispute the inferior is blessed by the more prominent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in this case mortal men receive tithes, but in that case it is testified that he lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, so to speak, even Levi, the one who receives tithes, has paid tithes through Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he was still in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus if perfection was through the Levitical priesthood, for on the basis of it the people received the law, what further need is there for another priest to arise according to the order of Melchizedek and not said to be according to the order of Aaron?
speaker: Narrator

text: For when the priesthood changes, of necessity there is a change of the law also.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the one about whom these things are spoken belongs to another tribe from which no one has officiated at the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is evident that our Lord is a descendant of Judah, a tribe with reference to which Moses said nothing concerning priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it is still more clear, if another priest according to the likeness of Melchizedek arises,
speaker: Narrator

text: who has become a priest not according to a law of physical requirement, but according to the power of an indestructible life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it is testified,
“You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For on the one hand a preceding commandment is set aside because of its weakness and uselessness
speaker: Narrator

text: (for the law made nothing perfect), but on the other hand there is the introduction of a better hope through which we draw near to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by as much as this was not without an oath (for these on the one hand have become priests without an oath,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but he with an oath by the one who said to him,
“The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind,
    ‘You are a priest forever’”),
speaker: Narrator

text: by so much more Jesus has become the guarantee of a better covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And indeed many have become priests, because they were prevented by death from continuing in office,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he, because he continues forever, holds the priesthood permanently.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore also he is able to save completely those who draw near to God through him, because he always lives in order to intercede on their behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a high priest such as this indeed is fitting for us, holy, innocent, undefiled, separated from sinners, and having become exalted above the heavens,
speaker: Narrator

text: who does not need every day like the former high priests to offer up sacrifices for his own sins and then for the sins of the people, because he did this once for all when he offered up himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the law appoints men as high priests who have weakness, but the statement of the oath, after the law, appoints a Son, who is made perfect forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is the main point in what has been said: we have a high priest such as this, who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: a minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord set up, not man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every high priest is appointed in order to offer both gifts and sacrifices; therefore it was necessary for this one also to have something that he offers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if he were on earth, he would not even be a priest, because there are those who offer the gifts according to the law,
speaker: Narrator

text: who serve a sketch and shadow of the heavenly things, just as Moses was warned when he was about to complete the tabernacle, for he says, “See to it that you make everything according to the pattern which was shown to you on the mountain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But now he has attained a more excellent ministry, by as much as he is also mediator of a better covenant which has been enacted upon better promises.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if that first covenant had been faultless, occasion would not have been sought for a second.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For in finding fault with them he says,
“Behold, days are coming, says the Lord,
    when I will complete a new covenant with the house of Israel
    and with the house of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text:
not like the covenant which I made with their fathers
    on the day I took hold of them by my hand
    to lead them out of the land of Egypt,
because they did not continue in my covenant
    and I disregarded them, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this is the covenant that I will decree with the house of Israel
    after those days, says the Lord:
I am putting my laws in their minds
    and I will write them on their hearts,
and I will be their God
    and they will be my people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they will not teach each one his fellow citizen
    and each one his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord,’
because they will all know me,
    from the least of them to the greatest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will be merciful toward their wrongdoings,
    and I will not remember their sins any longer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In calling it new, he has declared the former to be old. Now what is becoming obsolete and growing old is near to disappearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first covenant had regulations for worship and the earthly sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a tent was prepared, the first one, in which were the lampstand and the table and the presentation of the loaves, which is called the holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the second curtain was a tent called the holy of holies,
speaker: Narrator

text: containing the golden incense altar and the ark of the covenant covered on all sides with gold, in which were a golden jar containing the manna and the rod of Aaron that budded and the tablets of the covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And above it were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat, about which it is not now possible to speak in detail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these things having been prepared in this way, the priests enter into the first tent continually as they accomplish their service,
speaker: Narrator

text: but only the high priest enters into the second tent once a year, not without blood, which he offers on behalf of himself and the sins of the people committed in ignorance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Holy Spirit was making this clear, that the way into the holy place was not yet revealed, while the first tent was still in existence,
speaker: Narrator

text: which was a symbol for the present time, in which both the gifts and sacrifices which were offered were not able to perfect the worshiper with respect to the conscience,
speaker: Narrator

text: concerning instead only food and drink and different washings, regulations of outward things imposed until the time of setting things right.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Christ has arrived as a high priest of the good things to come. Through the greater and more perfect tent not made by hands, that is, not of this creation,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood, he entered once for all into the most holy place, obtaining eternal redemption.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a young cow sprinkled on those who are defiled sanctify them for the ritual purity of the flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: how much more will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, cleanse our consciences from dead works to serve the living God?
speaker: Narrator

text: And because of this, he is the mediator of a new covenant, in order that, because a death has taken place for the redemption of transgressions committed during the first covenant, those who are the called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For where there is a will, it is a necessity for the death of the one who made the will to be established.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a will is in force concerning those who are dead, since it is never in force when the one who made the will is alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore not even the first covenant was ratified without blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when every commandment had been spoken by Moses to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves with water and scarlet wool and hyssop and sprinkled both the scroll itself and all the people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying,
“This is the blood of the covenant that God has commanded for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And likewise he sprinkled both the tabernacle and all the utensils of service with the blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, nearly everything is purified with blood according to the law, and apart from the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it was necessary for the sketches of the things in heaven to be purified with these sacrifices, but the heavenly things themselves to be purified with better sacrifices than these.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Christ did not enter into a sanctuary made by hands, a mere copy of the true one, but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God on our behalf,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not in order that he can offer himself many times, as the high priest enters into the sanctuary year by year with blood not his own,
speaker: Narrator

text: since it would have been necessary for him to suffer many times from the foundation of the world, but now he has appeared once at the end of the ages for the removal of sin by the sacrifice of himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And just as it is destined for people to die once, and after this, judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text: thus also Christ, having been offered once in order to bear the sins of many, will appear for the second time without reference to sin to those who eagerly await him for salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the law, possessing a shadow of the good things that are about to come, not the form of things itself, is never able year by year by means of the same sacrifices which they offer without interruption to make perfect those who draw near.
speaker: Narrator

text: For otherwise, would they not have ceased to be offered, because the ones who worship, having been purified once and for all, would no longer have any consciousness of sins?
speaker: Narrator

text: But in them there is a reminder of sins year by year.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: you did not delight in whole burnt offerings and offerings for sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come—
in the roll of the book it is written about me—
    to do your will, O God.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he says above,
“Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and offerings for sin
    you did not want, nor did you delight in,”
which are offered according to the law,
speaker: Narrator

text:
then he has said,
“Behold, I have come to do your will.”
He takes away the first in order to establish the second,
speaker: Narrator

text: by which will we are made holy through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every priest stands every day serving and offering the same sacrifices many times, which are never able to take away sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this one, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for all time, sat down at the right hand of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: from now on waiting until his enemies are made a footstool for his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by one offering he has perfected for all time those who are made holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Holy Spirit also testifies to us, for after saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“This is the covenant that I will decree for them
    after those days, says the Lord:
I am putting my laws on their hearts,
    and I will write them on their minds.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also says,
“Their sins and their lawless deeds I will never remember again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now where there is forgiveness of these, there is no longer an offering for sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, brothers, since we have confidence for the entrance into the sanctuary by the blood of Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: by the new and living way which he inaugurated for us through the curtain, that is, his flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: and since we have a great priest over the house of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: let us approach with a true heart in the full assurance of faith, our hearts sprinkled clean from an evil conscience and our bodies washed with pure water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us hold fast to the confession of our hope without wavering, for the one who promised is faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let us think about how to stir one another up to love and good works,
speaker: Narrator

text: not abandoning our meeting together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging each other, and by so much more as you see the day drawing near.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if we keep on sinning deliberately after receiving the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins,
speaker: Narrator

text: but a certain fearful expectation of judgment and a fury of fire that is about to consume the adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone who rejected the law of Moses dies without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: How much worse punishment do you think the person will be considered worthy of who treats with disdain the Son of God and who considers ordinary the blood of the covenant by which he was made holy and who insults the Spirit of grace?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For we know the one who said,
“Vengeance is mine, I will repay,”
and again,
“The Lord will judge his people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a terrifying thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But remember the former days in which, after you were enlightened, you endured a great struggle with sufferings,
speaker: Narrator

text: sometimes being publicly exposed both to insults and to afflictions, and sometimes becoming sharers with those who were treated in this way.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you both sympathized with the prisoners and put up with the seizure of your belongings with joy because you knew that you yourselves had a better and permanent possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore do not throw away your confidence, which has great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have need of endurance, in order that after you have done the will of God, you may receive what was promised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For yet
“a very, very little while,
    and the one who is coming will come and will not delay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But my righteous one will live by faith,
    and if he shrinks back, my soul is not well pleased with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But we are not among those who shrink back to destruction, but among those who have faith to the preservation of our souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now faith is the realization of what is hoped for, the proof of things not seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by this the people of old were approved.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith we understand the worlds were created by the word of God, in order that what is seen did not come into existence from what is visible.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Abel offered to God a greater sacrifice than Cain, by which he was approved that he was righteous, because God approved him for his gifts, and through it he still speaks, although he is dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Enoch was taken up, so that he did not experience death, and he was not found, because God took him up. For before his removal, he had been approved as having been pleasing to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now without faith it is impossible to please him, for the one who approaches God must believe that he exists and is a rewarder of those who seek him.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Noah, having been warned about things not yet seen, out of reverence constructed an ark for the deliverance of his family, by which he pronounced sentence on the world and became an heir of the righteousness that comes by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Abraham, when he was called, obeyed to go out to a place that he was going to receive for an inheritance, and he went out, not knowing where he was going.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith he lived in the land of promise as a stranger, living in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the fellow heirs of the same promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he was expecting the city that has foundations, whose architect and builder is God.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith also, with Sarah, he received the ability to procreate even past the normal age, because he regarded the one who had promised to be faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And therefore these were fathered from one man, and he being as good as dead, as the stars of heaven in number and like the innumerable sand by the shore of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: These all died in faith without receiving the promises, but seeing them from a distance and welcoming them, and admitting that they were strangers and temporary residents on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who say such things make clear that they are seeking a homeland.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if they remember that land from which they went out, they would have had opportunity to return.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now they aspire to a better land, that is, a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed of them, to be called their God, for he has prepared for them a city.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Abraham, when he was tested, offered Isaac, and the one who received the promises was ready to offer his one and only son,
speaker: Narrator

text: with reference to whom it was said, “In Isaac your descendants will be named,”
speaker: Narrator

text: having reasoned that God was able even to raise him from the dead, from which he received him back also as a symbol.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith also Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things that were going to happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Jacob, as he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph and worshiped, leaning on the top of his staff.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Joseph, as he was dying, mentioned about the exodus of the sons of Israel and gave instructions about his bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hidden for three months by his parents, because they saw the child was handsome, and they were not afraid of the edict of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Moses, when he was grown up, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter,
speaker: Narrator

text: choosing instead to be mistreated with the people of God rather than to experience the transitory enjoyment of sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: considering reproach endured for the sake of Christ greater wealth than the treasures of Egypt, for he was looking to the reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith he left Egypt, not fearing the anger of the king, for he persevered as if he saw the invisible one.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, in order that the one who destroyed the firstborn would not touch them.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith they crossed the Red Sea as if on dry land; the Egyptians, when they made the attempt, were drowned.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down after they had been marched around for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: By faith Rahab the prostitute did not perish with those who were disobedient, because she welcomed the spies in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what more shall I say? For time would fail me to tell about Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, and Samuel and the prophets,
speaker: Narrator

text: who through faith conquered kingdoms, accomplished justice, obtained what was promised, shut the mouths of lions,
speaker: Narrator

text: extinguished the effectiveness of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, were made strong from weakness, became mighty in battle, put to flight enemy battle lines.
speaker: Narrator

text: Women received back their dead by resurrection. But others were tortured, not accepting release, in order that they might gain a better resurrection.
speaker: Narrator

text: And others experienced mocking and flogging, and in addition bonds and imprisonment.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were stoned, they were sawed in two, they died by murder with a sword, they wandered about in sheepskins, in goatskins, impoverished, afflicted, mistreated,
speaker: Narrator

text: of whom the world was not worthy, wandering about on deserts and mountains and in caves and in holes in the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And although they all were approved through their faith, they did not receive what was promised,
speaker: Narrator

text: because God had provided something better for us, so that they would not be made perfect without us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, since we also have such a great cloud of witnesses surrounding us, putting aside every weight and the sin that so easily ensnares us, let us run with patient endurance the race that has been set before us,
speaker: Narrator

text: fixing our eyes on Jesus, the originator and perfecter of faith, who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, disregarding the shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For consider the one who endured such hostility by sinners against himself, so that you will not grow weary in your souls and give up.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood as you struggle against sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And have you completely forgotten the exhortation which instructs you as sons?
“My son, do not make light of the Lord’s discipline,
    or give up when you are corrected by him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord disciplines the one whom he loves,
    and punishes every son whom he accepts.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Endure it for discipline. God is dealing with you as sons. For what son is there whom a father does not discipline?
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you are without discipline, in which all legitimate sons have become participants, then you are illegitimate and not sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, we have had our earthly fathers who disciplined us, and we respected them. Will we not much rather subject ourselves to the Father of spirits and live?
speaker: Narrator

text: For they disciplined us for a few days according to what seemed appropriate to them, but he does so for our benefit, in order that we can have a share in his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all discipline seems for the moment not to be joyful but painful, but later it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness for those who are trained by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore strengthen your slackened hands and your weakened knees,
speaker: Narrator

text: and make straight paths for your feet, so that what is lame will not be dislocated, but rather be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pursue peace with everyone, and holiness, without which no one will see the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take care that no one falls short of the grace of God; that no one growing up like a root of bitterness causes trouble, and by it many become defiled;
speaker: Narrator

text: that no one be a sexually immoral or totally worldly person like Esau, who for one meal traded his own birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you know that also afterwards, when he wanted to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, because he did not find an occasion for repentance, although he sought it with tears.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have not come to something that can be touched, and to a burning fire, and to darkness, and to gloom, and to a whirlwind,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to the noise of a trumpet, and to the sound of words which those who heard begged that not another word be spoken to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they could not endure what was commanded: “If even an animal touches the mountain, it must be stoned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the spectacle was so terrifying that Moses said, “I am terrified and trembling.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But you have come to Mount Zion, and to the city of the living God, to the heavenly Jerusalem, and to tens of thousands of angels, to the festal gathering
speaker: Narrator

text: and assembly of the firstborn who are enrolled in heaven, and to God the judge of all, and to the spirits of righteous people made perfect,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to Jesus, the mediator of a new covenant, and to the sprinkled blood that speaks better than Abel’s does.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch out that you do not refuse the one who is speaking! For if those did not escape when they refused the one who warned them on earth, much less will we escape, if we reject the one who warns from heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text:
whose voice shook the earth at that time, but now he has promised, saying,
“Yet once more I will shake not only the earth but also heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the phrase “yet once more” indicates the removal of what is shaken, namely, things that have been created, in order that the things that are not shaken may remain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, since we are receiving an unshakable kingdom, let us be thankful, through which let us serve God acceptably, with awe and reverence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed our God is a consuming fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brotherly love must continue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not neglect hospitality, because through this some have received angels as guests without knowing it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the prisoners, as though you were fellow-prisoners; remember the mistreated, as though you yourselves also are being mistreated in the body.
speaker: Narrator

text: Marriage must be held in honor by all, and the marriage bed be undefiled, because God will judge sexually immoral people and adulterers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your lifestyle must be free from the love of money, being content with what you have. For he himself has said, “I will never desert you, and I will never abandon you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So then, we can say with confidence,
“The Lord is my helper, I will not be afraid.
What will man do to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember your leaders, who spoke the word of God to you; considering the outcome of their way of life, imitate their faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be carried away by various and strange teachings, for it is good for the heart to be strengthened by grace, not by foods by which those who participate have not benefited.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have an altar from which those who serve in the tabernacle do not have the right to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the bodies of those animals whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sins are burned up outside the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jesus also suffered outside the gate, in order that he might sanctify the people by his own blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we must go out to him outside the camp, bearing his reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: For here we do not have a permanent city, but we seek the city that is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore through him let us offer up a sacrifice of praise continually to God, that is, the fruit of lips that confess his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And do not neglect doing good and generosity, for God is pleased with such sacrifices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obey your leaders and submit to them, for they keep watch over your souls as those who will give an account, so that they can do this with joy and not with groaning, for this would be unprofitable for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray for us, for we are convinced that we have a good conscience, and want to conduct ourselves commendably in every way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I especially urge you to do this, so that I may be restored to you more quickly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now may the God of peace, who brought up from the dead our Lord Jesus, the great shepherd of the sheep, by the blood of the eternal covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: equip you with every good thing to do his will, carrying out in us what is pleasing before him through Jesus Christ, to whom be the glory forever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I urge you, brothers, bear with my word of exhortation, for indeed I have written to you briefly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know that our brother Timothy has been released, with whom I will see you, if he comes quickly enough.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet all your leaders and all the saints. Those from Italy greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace be with all of you.
speaker: Narrator
